objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: Does the defense have any questions?

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Yes, your honor.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Mr. Hyland, what prompted you to check on Eduardo and your brother at Warehouse Six?

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: I'm very close to my brother.

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: I just wanted to make sure that my brother wasn't being mistreated too badly by my bodyguard.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Do you always have a bodyguard while in the public?

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: Yes. My safety would be at risk otherwise.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: (Something is not right.)

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: If you were close to your brother, why did you send out Eduardo to deal with him?

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: Eduardo is the person who I turn to to deal with my brother.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: What was the relationship between your brother and Eduardo like?

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: Eduardo was always looking for a fight with my brother. I don't think he particularly liked my brother.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: You're asserting that Eduardo was actively in aggression against Mr. Hyland?

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: Yes.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: According to the written testimony by my client, Eduardo never wanted to fight your brother.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: If Eduardo were the aggressor in this situation, would he kill your brother,

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: despite knowing that you were aware of their meeting?

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: If Eduardo was trying to truly harm Mr. Hyland, surely he would try to establish plausible deniability?

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: That can't be right.

objects.name: Alex
objects.text: Nice! You managed to point out a logical inconsistency.

objects.name: Alex
objects.text: If you point out two more inconsistencies, we can destroy Gabriel's credibility as a witness!

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Furthermore, your brother:

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: An acceptable response to assault with imminent danger is self defense.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Eduardo was simply participating in self-defense in an attempt to defuse the situation.

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: Sure, but Eduardo killed my brother!

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Is that so? What did you perceive as the murder weapon?

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: The murder weapon is obviously the tactical knife!

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Are you sure that the murder weapon is the tactical knife?

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: Yes!

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The autopsy report of the late Mr. Hyland seems to suggest otherwise.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The murder weapon cannot be the tactical knife.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Eduardo said in his written testimony that he only stabbed Mr. Hyland in a noncritical area.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The autopsy report seems to support Eduardo's claim, as the knife stab wound is present.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: However, the autopsy seems to suggest that the wound is in fact:
multipleChoice: clearly a incident of ricin poisoning.
too deep for a standard stab wound.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The stab wound is clearly too deep for a stab wound.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: If the tactical knife is not the true murder weapon, then what's the real murder weapon?

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: Pft. I don't know. I only saw the tactical knife.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Are you sure that you've never the murder weapon that is not the tactical knife?

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: Of course not. I'm not the murderer.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: That seems to directly contradict the case report written by Detective Burke.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The autopsy report, interestingly enough, found:
multipleChoice: trace amounts of aluminum in the stab wound.
an eraser was stuck on the surface of the stab wound.

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: Okay, so?

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The murder weapon is something that you use on a daily basis, State Senator Hyland.

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: That's preposterous!

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Or is it, State Senator Hyland?

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: This is a tactical pen made from anodized aluminum.

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: Okay? I don't see how this is relevant.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: On the contrary, State Senator Hyland.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The case report seems to indicate that you had an identical tactical pen to the one I have here.

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: I carry spare tactical pens around. So what?

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Detective Burke's report seems to have found the burnt remains of an aluminum object.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Why would there be burnt remains of an aluminum object?

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: How would I know?

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The only reason that melted aluminum would remain is if:
multipleChoice: the murderer tried to explode the aluminum.
the murderer accidentally dropped the aluminum pen.
the murderer tried to vaporize the pen.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The murderer clearly wanted to get rid of the murder weapon as fast as possible.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The murder weapon, since it was metal, needed to be disposed in a suitable fashion.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The true murderer of Mr. Hyland wanted to get rid of the murder weapon by:
multipleChoice: burning it in a propane furnace.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The murderer had thought that the aluminum pen would vaporize via the gasoline flames.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: This, however, prove to be their undoing.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The boiling point of aluminum is 2,470 degrees Celsius.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The temperature of a gasoline flame in air only reaches up to 2,138 degrees Celsius.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The true murderer failed to do their homework to ensure all evidence was lost.

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: This is craziness. You can't be serious.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: To the contrary, my dear State Senator.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: In Eduardo's written testimony, he noted that you always carry around two pens.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: If the clerk could read back to us the prior statement regarding Gabriel carrying tactical pens.

objects.name: Felix
objects.text: Objection!

objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: Objection overruled. The defense is allowed to use the court transcript.

objects.name: Clerk
objects.text: The court transcript says:

objects.name: Clerk
objects.text: 'I carry spare tactical pens around. So what?'

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: It seems highly coincidental that the case report only noted you having one tactical pen with you,

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: despite Eduardo's written testimony suggesting that you typically carry around two.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: What happened to that extra tactical pen, State Senator Hyland?

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: You can't be serious.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: State Senator Hyland's tactical pen was the true murder weapon.

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: This is slanderous, I say! Absolutely slanderous!

objects.name: Alex
objects.text: Nice! You pointed out another logical inconsistency. He should now at least be a potential accomplice to the crime.

objects.name: Alex
objects.text: One more refutation of his logic should have this case completely closed.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: One last thing, State Senator Hyland.

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: What in tarnation is your crazy argument now?

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: State Senator Hyland, I notice that you're currently wearing your iconic leather gloves.

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: I don't see the point in this question. Of course I'm wearing my gloves.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: That's quite interesting, State Senator Hyland.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Were you wearing those gloves on the day of your brother's murder?

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: Of course. I always wear them when I'm away from home.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Now, as a hypothetical, would a killer use nitrile gloves for the murder?

objects.name: Felix
objects.text: Objection! The opposing side is unnecessarily leading on my client.

objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: Objection overruled. It does not unfairly jeopardize the credibility of the witness.

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: Probably? I don't know. I'm not the murderer.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: What if I told you that:
multipleChoice: the glove that was found in the crime scene was leather.
there was a nitrile glove in the scene.
there was a nitrile glove with a hole at the crime scene.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: More interestingly, there seems to be little blood splatter from the nitrile glove.

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: Okay, Missy Detective, I don't know how that matters to me.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Ladies and gentlemen of the court, please observe the splatter of the nitrile glove.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The nitrile glove shows that much of the blood splatter is on the right glove.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Though it may be difficult to discern, the case report notes that there is a hole on the right glove.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The case report by Detective Burke notes that forensics discovered trace amounts of:

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The case report also observes that Eduardo was not wearing leather gloves.

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: No. That can't be.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: If Eduardo is not true culprit of the murder, then the murderer must be:

objects.name: Jury
objects.text: Audible gasping.

objects.name: Felix
objects.text: Objection! The opposing side is being unreasonable.

objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: Even I can't believe this. Objection overruled.

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: IMPOSSSSIBLEEEE! YOU DARNED PUBLIC DEFENDER!

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: IT WAS THE PERFECT COVERUP! WHAT KIND OF MAGIC DID YOU USE?!

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: It was just a matter of sound inductive logic. Quite elementary, my dear State Senator.

objects.name: Alex
objects.text: Oh, nice burn. He's acting just like a schoolkid.

objects.name: Alex
objects.text: There's no way he can recover from that logical refutation.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: I have no further questions.

objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: The witness is excused.

objects.name: Gabriel
objects.text: NOOOOOOOOO! THIS CAN'T BEEEEEEEE!

objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: Does the defense rest?

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Yes, your honor.

objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: Ladies and gentlemen of the jury, I am going to read the law that you must follow when deciding this case.

objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: To prove the felony charged against the defendant, the prosecution must prove that:

objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: First, Eduardo Fuentes planned the murder of Joshua Hyland.

objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: Secondly, Eduardo Fuentes was the person to apply the final trauma to Joshua Hyland.

objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: Lastly, Eduardo Fuentes left evidence to confirm him as the murderer of Joshua Hyland.

objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: If each of you believes that the prosecution proved all three points beyond reasonable doubt, you should find the defendant guilty of the felony.

objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: However, if you find that the prosecution did not prove one of the three points beyond reasonable doubt, you must find the defendant not guilty of the felony.

objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: Proof beyond a reasonable doubt does not mean beyond all doubt.

objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: It simply means you must be very sure that the charge is true.

objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: Are you ready with your final arguments?

objects.name: Felix
objects.text: Yes, your honor.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Yes, your honor.

objects.name: Felix
objects.text: Your Honor and ladies and gentlemen of the jury:

objects.name: Felix
objects.text: The judge has told you that we must prove three allegations.

objects.name: Felix
objects.text: First, the defendant had prior altercations with the victim, Joshua Hyland.

objects.name: Felix
objects.text: There is no doubt that the defendant would harm the victim.

objects.name: Felix
objects.text: Second, the case report suggests that the murder weapon on the scene was the tactical knife.

objects.name: Felix
objects.text: The autopsy report similarly suggests that the wound must have originated from the knife.

objects.name: Felix
objects.text: Lastly, the case report and the autopsy report found the defendant on the crime scene.

objects.name: Felix
objects.text: All evidence suggests that the defendant murdered the victim.

objects.name: Felix
objects.text: By virtue of the evidence, you must find the defendant guilty.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Your Honor and ladies and gentlemen of the jury:

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Eduardo Fuentes was just a security guard doing his duty.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Though Eduardo may have created the initial trauma,

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: My evidence shows that Eduardo was not the culprit of the final trauma.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The truth of the case is that State Senator Hyland tried to frame the crime on Eduardo.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: State Senator Hyland applied the final trauma to remove the nuisance, his brother.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: I will remind you that the prosecution must prove every point.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: The prosecution has presented no real evidence to show that Eduardo was the murderer.

objects.name: Artemis
objects.text: Since there is reasonable doubt, you must find Eduardo not guilty.

objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: Will the jury foreperson please stand?

objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: Has the jury reached an unanimous verdict?

objects.name: Jury
objects.text: Yes.

objects.name: Clerk
objects.text: The jury finds the defendant not guilty for felonious charges.

objects.name: Clerk
objects.text: The jury finds that the defendant is guilty for misdemeanor for battery and being an unknowing accomplice to a murder.

objects.name: Judge Barrett
objects.text: The jury is thanked and excused. Court is adjourned.
